message.content: Yes, the authors discuss whether the data they are using/curating contains personally identifiable information or offensive content. In the Broader Impacts section (B.5), they mention that the SCIENCEQA dataset does not contain any user usage data or personally sensitive information such as gender and race. They also state that they have not found any improper content, including pornographic information, racial remarks, or harmful social bias, after careful examination of the dataset. The authors also express their commitment to removing any anti-social data points from the dataset based on feedback.

Yes, the authors discuss whether the data they are using/curating contains personally identifiable information or offensive content. They mention that the SCIENCEQA dataset does not contain any user usage data or personally sensitive information such as gender and race. They have also carefully examined the dataset and have not found any improper content, such as pornographic information, racial remarks, or harmful social bias. The authors are committed to the goal of AI for the common good, and they will remove any anti-social data points from the dataset based on feedback.

Yes, the authors discuss whether the data they are using/curating contains personally identifiable information or offensive content. In the "B.5 Broader Impacts" section, they explicitly mention that the SCIENCEQA dataset does not contain any user usage data or personally sensitive information such as gender and race. They have also carefully examined the dataset and did not find any improper content, such as pornographic information, racial remarks, or harmful social bias. The authors also mention that they are open to feedback and will remove any anti-social data points from the dataset based on such input.
